objects.name: Analytic 0085
objects.description: Adversary uses a tool like Ruler to insert a malicious custom form into the user's Outlook mailbox. The form is designed to auto-execute on Outlook startup or on receipt of a specially crafted email. This results in child processes launched from outlook.exe and possibly network connections or payload loading.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: WinEventLog:Application
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Outlook errors loading or processing custom form templates

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: WinEventLog:PowerShell
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Execution of Microsoft script to enumerate custom forms in Outlook mailbox

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Malicious forms may be stored in various user-specific locations in the Outlook mailbox (e.g., IPM.Note class)
Child process spawned by outlook.exe may vary (e.g., powershell.exe, rundll32.exe, mshta.exe)
Form-triggered execution may happen immediately upon Outlook startup or with delay after crafted message arrival
Form behavior and error logs may vary across Outlook 2013, 2016, and M365 builds
Attack may target only specific users; contextual correlation needed for account baselining
